name: CPS_3_6_Support_Self_Care
title: CPS.3.6 Support Self-Care (Function)
description: Provide the patient with decision support for self-management of a condition between patient/provider encounters.
purpose: Patients need to follow self-management plans related to their specific conditions. These plans may include schedules for home monitoring, laboratory tests, and clinical checkups; recommendations about nutrition, physical activity, tobacco use, etc.; and guidance or reminders about medications. Information to support self-care may be appropriately provided to: the patient, a surrogate (parent, spouse, guardian), or others involved directly in the patients self care.

statement.label: CPS.3.6#01
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to capture, maintain and render patient guidelines, protocols and reminders related to specific clinical conditions.

statement.label: CPS.3.6#02
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to determine patient eligibility for, and render appropriate patient guidelines, protocols, and reminders for, self-management of clinical conditions.

statement.label: CPS.3.6#03
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD conform to function [[CPS.2.5]] (Support patient-originated Data).

statement.label: CPS.3.6#04
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD conform to function [[CP.1.8]] (Manage Patient and Family Preferences).

statement.label: CPS.3.6#05
statement.requirement: The system SHALL conform to function [[CP.1.4]] (Manage Problem list).
